title: WCAS HISTORY 300-0-36 New Lectures in History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course explores the history of the British Empire, from its origins in the early modern world through its Victorian heights and decline in the twentieth century. We will consider how and why a tiny island managed to control a quarter of the earth's population. In addition, we will discuss how colonized people negotiated, resisted, and ended British rule. This course will focus on both the political and economic histories of the British Empire and the histories of ordinary people around the British world.
